keyTakeAways: Sam Rivers, the bass player of Limp Bizkit, died in October 2025, prompting emotional tributes from band members.
Rivers was praised for his unmatched musical presence and emotional depth in the band’s sound.
He left the band in 2015 due to liver disease and underwent a liver transplant, later reuniting with the band in 2018.
The band’s legacy is rooted in Jacksonville, Florida, blending alternative rock, heavy metal, and rap with a bold, humorous style.
Limp Bizkit is set to begin a Central and South American tour in late November 2025, continuing their global music presence after Rivers’ death.
The band members, particularly Fred Durst, emphasized Rivers' musical genius and emotional impact, calling him 'the soul in the sound'.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sam Rivers, the bassist of Limp Bizkit, has died in October 2025, with band members expressing deep grief and honoring his legacy as 'the soul in the sound.' Rivers, who left the band in 2015 due to liver disease and later returned after a transplant in 2018, was celebrated for his unique musical ability to infuse sadness and rhythm into the band’s music. The band, formed in Jacksonville, Florida, continues its global presence with a planned tour of Central and South America beginning in late November 2025. Band members, especially lead vocalist Fred Durst, emphasize Rivers’ profound influence on their music and personal lives, citing shared love of grunge bands like Mother Love Bone, Alice in Chains, and Stone Temple Pilots. The article highlights both the emotional significance of Rivers’ death and the enduring cultural impact of Limp Bizkit through its humor, genre-blending sound, and ongoing global tours.
title: Limp Bizkit Band Members Say Bass Player Sam Rivers Has Died
